Package FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers

Class CategoryController

java.lang.Object
FinanceTrackerSystem.Controllers.CategoryController
public class CategoryController extends Object
Provides static methods to manage categories and subcategories for the currently logged-in user in the Finance Tracker System. This controller supports adding, viewing, editing, deleting categories and subcategories, and retrieving category information by name or ID.

Responsibilities

  • Add new main categories and subcategories for the current user.
  • Display all categories (main and subcategories) belonging to the current user.
  • Edit category details, including name and type.
  • Delete categories, updating subcategory relationships as needed.
  • Retrieve category UUIDs and types by name or ID for cross-referencing in transactions and budgets.

Usage Example

 CategoryController.addCategory(CategoryType.EXPENSE, "Groceries");
 CategoryController.addSubCategory(CategoryType.EXPENSE, "Vegetables", "Groceries");
 CategoryController.viewCategories();
 CategoryController.editCategory("Groceries", "Food", CategoryType.EXPENSE);
 CategoryController.deleteCategory("Food");
 UUID id = CategoryController.getCategoryIdByName("Vegetables");
 CategoryType type = CategoryController.getCategoryTypeById(id);

Dependencies

  • Category - The category model being managed.
  • invalid @link 
    Models.enums.CategoryType
    - Enum for category type (INCOME, EXPENSE).
  • UserController - For accessing currentUser and saving user details.

Thread Safety

This class is not thread-safe. All operations assume single-threaded access to currentUser. If used in a multi-threaded environment, external synchronization is required.

Validation

This class performs basic validation (e.g., existence of category, parent category, and user). Further validation (such as name uniqueness or input format) should be handled externally.

Extensibility

Additional category operations (such as color, icon, or audit logging) can be added as needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • CategoryController

      public CategoryController()

  • Method Details

    • addCategory

      public static boolean addCategory(CategoryType categoryType, String categoryName)
      Adds a new main category for the current user. The category is added to the user's category list and persisted.
      Parameters:
      categoryType - The type of the category (e.g., INCOME, EXPENSE).
      categoryName - The name of the new category.
      Returns:
      true if the category is added and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • addSubCategory

      public static boolean addSubCategory(CategoryType categoryType, String categoryName, String parentCategoryName)
      Adds a new subcategory under a specified parent category for the current user. The subcategory is linked to its parent and persisted.
      Parameters:
      categoryType - The type of the subcategory.
      categoryName - The name of the new subcategory.
      parentCategoryName - The name of the parent category.
      Returns:
      true if the subcategory is added and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • viewCategories

      public static void viewCategories()
      Displays all categories belonging to the current user. Prints "No categories found." if there are no categories. Each category is displayed using its Category.toString() representation.

    • editCategory

      public static boolean editCategory(String categoryName, String newCategoryName, CategoryType newCategoryType)
      Edits the name and type of an existing category. If the category is found, updates its name and type, then persists user details.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category to edit.
      newCategoryName - The new name for the category.
      newCategoryType - The new type for the category.
      Returns:
      true if the category is updated and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • deleteCategory

      public static boolean deleteCategory(String categoryName)
      Deletes a category with the specified name from the current user's category list. If the category is a main category, its subcategories will have their parent set to null and will be marked as main categories. The category is then removed and user details persisted.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the category is deleted and user details are saved successfully; false otherwise.

    • getCategoryIdByName

      public static UUID getCategoryIdByName(String categoryName)
      Retrieves the unique ID (UUID) of a category by its name. Useful for cross-referencing categories in transactions and budgets.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category.
      Returns:
      UUID of the category if found; null otherwise.

    • getCategoryTypeByName

      public static CategoryType getCategoryTypeByName(String categoryName)
      Retrieves the type of a category by its name. Useful for determining transaction or budget logic based on category type.
      Parameters:
      categoryName - The name of the category.
      Returns:
      CategoryType of the category if found; null otherwise.

    • getCategoryTypeById

      public static CategoryType getCategoryTypeById(UUID categoryId)
      Retrieves the type of a category by its unique ID. Useful for determining transaction or budget logic based on category type.
      Parameters:
      categoryId - The UUID of the category.
      Returns:
      CategoryType of the category if found; null otherwise.
